bio: Chef John has been cooking traditional Chinese dishes for over 20 years. He specializes in Sichuan cuisine and loves to incorporate bold and spicy flavors in his dishes.

ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil. In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Add garlic, ginger, and dried chilies to the pan and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken back to the pan and stir in soy sauce mixture. Stir-fry for an additional 1-2 minutes, until sauce thickens. Stir in peanuts and serve over rice.

ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, cut into small cubes
recipes.cooking_method: In a small dry pan, toast Sichuan peppercorns over medium heat until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Grind in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Add garlic, ginger, doubanjiang, and fermented black beans and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add tofu and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in cornstarch mixture and simmer for an additional 1-2 minutes, until sauce thickens. Sprinkle with chopped scallions and serve over rice.
